qas.question: What is the rope made out of that the gymnists uses in their routine?

answers.text: Its length is in proportion to the size of the gymnast

qas.question: What are at the ends of the ropes to help the gymnists hold it?

answers.text: One or two knots at each end are for keeping hold of the rope while doing the routine.

qas.question: What other requirement is there for the rope?

answers.text: The rope must be coloured, either all or partially and may either be of a uniform diameter or be progressively thicker in the center

qas.question: When did FIG decide to nullify the use of ropes in competition?
What is made out of cotton and reeds?

plausible_answers.text: for keeping hold of the rope while doing the routine

qas.question: Why are the ropes covered in powder?
What is the anti-slip material made from?
In what year were ropes first used in the Gymnastic World Championships?

plausible_answers.text: Its length is in proportion to the size of the gymnast

qas.question: What is the length of gymnast head bands?

context: This apparatus may be made of <a0_0>hemp or a synthetic material<a0_0/> which retains the qualities of lightness and suppleness. <a1_0><b9_0>Its length is in proportion to the size of the gymnast<b9_0/><a1_0/>. <b5_0>The rope<b5_0/> should, when held down by the feet, reach both of the gymnasts' armpits. <a2_0>One or two knots at each end are <b6_0>for keeping hold of the rope while doing the routine<b6_0/>.<a2_0/> At the ends (to the exclusion of all other parts of the rope) an anti-slip material, either coloured or neutral may cover a maximum of 10 cm (3.94 in). <a3_0>The rope must be coloured, either all or partially and may either be of a uniform diameter or be progressively thicker in the center<a3_0/> provided that this thickening is of the <b7_0>same material as the rope<b7_0/>. The fundamental requirements of a rope routine include leaps and skipping. Other elements include swings, throws, circles, rotations and figures of eight. In <a4_0><b8_0>2011<b8_0/><a4_0/>, the FIG decided to nullify the use of rope in rhythmic gymnastic competitions.
